moves.1. Nf3 d5 2. d4 Bf5 3. c4 c6 4. Qb3 Qc8: A horrible blunder. 4... Q-N3 was necessary.
moves.5. cxd5: Caro immediately begins opening attacking lines.
moves.5... cxd5: Forced, if material equality is to be maintained.
moves.6. Nc3: Developing and attacking the weakened QP.
moves.6... e6: Defending, but falling even farther behind in development.
moves.7. Bf4: Clearing the square for the Rook to seize the open file.
moves.9. Nb6: A rusty nail in Lasker's knee or a bone in his throat. Pick your metaphor.
moves.12... g5: As good or bad as anything else.
moves.13. Ne5: 13 N-B8 ch would win the Exchange, but White is after bigger game. The threat is 14 Q-Q7 ch K-B3 15 QxBP mate.
moves.13... Nh6: If 13... N-B3, White has 14 N-B8 ch K-Q1 15 NxP mate.
moves.14. Nc8+: Lasker resigns. He has the grisly choice between losing his Q [14... QxN 15 RxQ, 14... K-B3 15 N-Q7 ch forking K and Q] or his K [14... K-Q1 15 Q-Q7 mate.]
